info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Schenectady, northern Schoharie and southern Montgomery Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1045 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sharon Springs, or 7 miles northwest of Cobleskill, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amsterdam, Cobleskill, Duanesburg, Sharon Springs, Fort Johnson, Delanson, Ames, Tribes Hill, Central Bridge, Glen, Princetown, Carlisle, Sharon, Seward, Charleston, Esperance, Duane, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners and West Richmondville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 22 and 24. Interstate 90 near exit 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
